summary:
Skilled and results-driven individual with a strong interest in renewable energy, electro organic synthesis, and electrochemistry. My educational background in Chemical Engineering, Energy Engineering, and Management, combined with my research experience in biomass gasification, pyrolysis oil electrochemical treatment, electrocatalysis, and electrolysers using analytical techniques such as GC TCD/FID, GC/HS-FID, NMR, Raman, and electrochemical techniques, have allowed me to develop expertise in these areas.

In addition, I have one year of experience working in the industry, specifically at Colgate Palmolive, where I honed my skills in project optimization and management. My experiences have given me a deep understanding of eco-innovation, continuous improvement, engineering principles, goods manufacturing practices GMP, quality control QC, data analysis, project and business management, and entrepreneurship.

As an adaptable and quick learner with a creative mindset, I am always open to challenging projects. I possess strong problem-solving skills and can tailor my approach to meet organizational needs and priorities, contributing effectively to achieving the company's goals.

Throughout my education, mobility, and career experiences, I have enjoyed working in cross-functional teams to produce sustainable solutions from technical and business perspectives, which further enhances my passion for sustainability, technology, and innovation.

projects.title: Design, Fabrication and Mathematical Modelling of Hybrid Capacitive Deionization Electrodialysis Module For Brackish Water Desalination
projects.description:
Pakistan is one of the third world country that has been facing water scarcity problems. Shrinking of drinking water resources acts as a major stipulation for country. According to WHO, 100% of ground water in Baluchistan, 75% of ground water in Sindh, 15% of ground water in Punjab and 1% in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa is brackish water (moderately saline) having TDS more than 3000 ppm.
Hybridization of Capacitive Deionization with Electrodialysis along with heterogeneous membranes acts a cheap, effective and environment friendly solution for this problem.

Thesis Objectives:
1. Design and fabrication of Capacitive Deionization Electrodialysis Module for water
    desalination.
2. To prepare cost effective Heterogeneous Membranes for Electrodialysis.
3. To Increase water desalination efficiency by hybridizing effective technologies.
4. To develop a mathematical equation system using numerical approach.
5. To predict the product water corrosion and scaling factor using Langelier and Carrier- Langelier Saturation Index Model.
6. Validation of Experimental results with Mathematical results.

projects.title: Smokeless Biomass Producer Gas Stove
projects.description: The biomass gasification stove is one of the convincing technology that utilizes the wood chips barks for production of wood gas with no emissions and no smoke. This technology is one of the most applicable technology in Pakistani Households, as Pakistan is one of the country whose 70% of the population is directly related the agriculture. So due to this enormous consumption, there is a wide scope of utilization of agricultural waste. Typically wood gas consists of: 22% carbon monoxide (CO), 18% hydrogen (H2), 3% methane (CH4), 6% carbon dioxide (CO2), 51% nitrogen (N2). 300g (0.7 lbs.) of sticks or chips burn for 30-45 minutes at high efficiency with low emissions. Serving as a miniature charcoal kiln, gasifiers can produce charcoal as a by-product of cooking. This may revolutionise the way charcoal is produced and utilised in the future. Gasifiers also have great potential to create downstream value chains through further use of char in agriculture, sanitation, water filtration, etc. If char is conserved, cooking with biomass can be a carbon-negative activity and sequester carbon from the atmosphere as a tool for climate change mitigation. Gasifier cook stoves may play a pivotal role at the nexus of water, energy and food security.

projects.title: Fluid Flow Metering And Friction Apparatus
projects.description:
There was an equipment with same name present in our deparment that is totally malfunctioned and on the basis of feasibilty studies we came to know that it cant be repair. So we decided to do this project in manufacturing of an economical flow metering and friction apparatus.
Basicallly this equipment is used to calculate the flow rate through different flow meters and there are many pressure drop area like the fitting of pipes and valves and also is can be used to determine the hedd loss.
Venturimeter, orificemeter, Rota meter and different types of valves are fitted in this equipment.
